item.title: Khan Younis: A Gaza city on its knees, now with a million mouths to feed
item.description: A desperate and destitute tide of humanity has washed into Khan Younis. And there is no help.

item.title: Gaza: UK pushing for Rafah crossing into Egypt to open
item.description: The Rafah crossing on Gaza's border with Egypt is currently the only route out of the territory.

item.title: Polish election: Right-wing ruling party to lose majority - exit poll
item.description: Donald Tusk's centrist opposition has a better chance of forming a coalition if the poll is right.

item.title: NHS Wales: Thousands of hours missing from A&E figures
item.description: A&E waits in Wales have been seriously under-reported in official figures each month for a decade.

item.title: Snapchat death crash mum's plea to stop drink-drivers
item.description: Dafydd Hughes was killed by an unlicensed driver filmed drinking a can of cider behind the wheel.

item.title: Scotland qualify for Euro 2024 finals in Germany as Spain beat Norway
item.description: Scotland qualify for Euro 2024 as Norway's loss to Spain secures a top-two finish in Group A for Steve Clarke's men.

item.title: SNP backs Humza Yousaf's Scottish independence plan
item.description: The party has voted for a strategy based on winning a majority of Scottish seats at a general election.

item.title: Charities 'concerned' over lack of progress with Renters Reform Bill
item.description: Thirty charities have warned Rishi Sunak not to abandon the bill banning no-fault evictions.

item.title: Boy, 6, killed in anti-Muslim attack, say US police
item.description: Police in Illinois link the killing of a boy and injuries to a woman to the ongoing Israel-Gaza war.

item.title: Dariush Mehrjui: Iranian director and wife found dead
item.description: Authorities in Iran say the couple was found dead at home after sustaining knife wound injuries.

item.title: Man charged over racist comments at pro-Palestine rally
item.description: The 67-year-old is alleged to have made racist comments during London's pro-Palestine rally.

item.title: Suzanne Somers: Three's Company actress dies aged 76
item.description: Somers was best known as one of the stars of the US sitcoms Three's Company and Step by Step.

item.title: Hong Kong: 11kg of suspected cocaine found in motorised wheelchair
item.description: A 51-year-old man could face life in prison after the discovery by Hong Kong airport officials.

item.title: The Lincolnshire village honoured in every Disney film since 2006
item.description: Walt Disney visited Norton Disney, Lincolnshire, in 1949, and Sleeping Beauty's castle changed forever.

item.title: The Papers: 'All-out war' fears and no 'glorifying terrorism'
item.description: Efforts to stop the conflict in Gaza spreading and a warning by the home secretary lead the papers.

item.title: Can the SNP's independence plan change the union's future?
item.description: Humza Yousaf sought to temper expectations of hungry SNP members at the party's annual conference.

item.title: A spooked and lonely Taiwan looks for new friends
item.description: China's incessant military drills drive Taiwan to look for support.

item.title: Same-sex hearing: The lesbian activist seeking marriage equality in India
item.description: Maya Sharma doesn't believe in marriage but has petitioned India's Supreme Court to legalise same-sex union.

item.title: Is the UK doing enough to monitor air pollution?
item.description: There are now 555 air quality monitors across the country, but some say they aren't good enough.

item.title: Do you know the deadline for secondary school applications?
item.description: The application rules and deadlines for 2024 secondary school places vary across the UK.

item.title: Scotland: Steve Clarke's side have qualified, but what now?
item.description: BBC Scotland takes a look at what next summer looks like for the Tartan Army at Euro 2024.

item.title: Madonna's Celebration Tour review: The Queen of pop brings out her crown jewels
item.description: The star is joined on stage by four of her children, who she thanks for saving her life this summer.

item.title: Worry in UK as Israel-Gaza anxiety spreads
item.description: Muslim and Jewish people share their feelings about the impact on each of their communities.

item.title: Supernova festival: One week on - survivor recalls traumatic escape from party
item.description: Shye Weinstein recorded on camera how he and his friends fled the site stormed by Hamas gunmen, who killed at least 260 people.

item.title: Watch: How 'ring of fire' eclipse burned across US skies
item.description: Stargazers witness a spectacular celestial event in parts of the US, Central and South America.

item.title: Wales’ Indiana Jones searching for lost mines in hills
item.description: Wooden crates still packed with dynamite sticks and even graves have been among his discoveries.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'texture'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Somalia's violin novice to TV orchestra triumph in four years
item.description: Audiences are lapping up televised orchestra performances reviving Somali music for a new generation.

item.title: What does TikTok's EGX sponsorship mean for the games industry?
item.description: The app's hoping to take on Twitch and YouTube to become the main stop for online video games content.

item.title: Scottish independence: How did we get here and what happens next?
item.description: The SNP are devising a new strategy as members gather in Aberdeen for the party's annual conference.

item.title: London vigil for victims of Hamas attack held
item.description: Hundreds who attended call for the release of more than 100 hostages taken during the attack on Israel.

item.title: TikTok says action taken on Israel conflict videos
item.description: The social media firm lists what it is doing to tackle misinformation after a warning by the EU.

item.title: South Africa recalls UN peacekeepers accused of sexual misconduct in DR Congo
item.description: Eight UN peacekeepers, originally from South Africa, are accused of breaching the organisation's rules.

item.title: Major disruption at Euston after signal failure
item.description: The issue, which has been resolved, is causing major disruption at one of London's busiest stations.

item.title: England 30-24 Fiji: Owen Farrell's boot seals Rugby World Cup semi-final spot
item.description: Owen Farrell's boot takes England to the Rugby World Cup semi-finals with a 30-24 victory against Fiji in Marseille.

item.title: France 28-29 South Africa: Defending champions overcome hosts in World Cup thriller
item.description: South Africa keep the defence of their title alive with a thrilling quarter-final victory over France in one of the greatest matches in World Cup history.

item.title: Cars in Luton Airport fire 'unlikely to be salvageable'
item.description: Emergency services have now handed back control of the multi-storey car park to the airport.

item.title: Medieval 'love motto' gold ring found near Frinton
item.description: The ring is engraved in French, the language of courtly love, and reads: "I desire to serve you".

item.title: Davido's twins: Afrobeats star describes having 'beautiful' babies a year after son's death
item.description: The Afrobeats megastar opens up about the aftermath of his three-year-old son's tragic death

item.title: Bafta Cymru: Hollywood star Luke Evans 'ecstatic' at win
item.description: The Hollywood actor dedicates his award to the "army" of people who put his BBC show together.

item.title: Russell T Davies: I want to write a darker LGBTQ+ drama
item.description: The It's A Sin writer says he wants to make something that reflects the "hatred in the air".

item.title: Rugby star Mike Phillips's Welsh praised after S4C boss sacked
item.description: "I prefer slack Welsh to slick English," says expert calling criticism of Mike Phillips embarrassing.

item.title: Rugby World Cup: England return joy to fans in Marseille by reaching semi-finals
item.description: It has not been a fun year for England rugby fans, but they finally got some joy back in Marseille on Sunday.

item.title: Wales 2-1 Croatia: Wilson double reignites Euro 2024 qualification hopes
item.description: Wales produce a stunning performance to beat Croatia and reignite their hopes of qualifying automatically for Euro 2024 in sensational fashion.

item.title: ICC Cricket World Cup highlights: England suffer shock defeat to Afghanistan
item.description: Watch highlights as England suffer a shock 69-run defeat to Afghanistan in Delhi at the Cricket World Cup.

item.title: Arsenal 2-1 Aston Villa: Beth Mead says it is 'amazing to be back' after 11-month injury ordeal
item.description: Arsenal and England forward Beth Mead calls her return to football "special" following 11 months of "torture" after a serious knee injury.

item.title: Rugby World Cup: England and South Africa reach semi-finals as hosts France knocked out
item.description: Watch the key moments from Sunday's Rugby World Cup quarter-finals as England knock out Fiji, while defending champions South Africa stun France.

item.title: Scotland manager Steve Clarke praises fans for helping Scotland become 'feared once again'
item.description: Scotland manager Steve Clarke hails his player for reaching successive European Championships and doubts they "will fully realise the significance of their achievement yet".

item.title: One week in Gaza: 'There are no safe places here'
item.description: Bombs, shortages, a life on the run. Bisan Owda, a filmmaker, has been documenting her days under siege.

item.title: Zaka: The volunteers giving dignity to Israel's dead
item.description: Zaka volunteers are used to being called to traumatic scenes, but nothing prepared them for the past week.

item.title: Strike on civilian convoy fleeing Gaza: What we know from verified video
item.description: Women and children were killed in Friday's strike on vehicles that were heading away from northern Gaza.

item.title: BBC in south Gaza: The scene is tragic
item.description: The BBC's Rushdi Abualouf says the city is struggling to cope as refugees from northern Gaza flood in.

item.title: Who's behind Israel-Gaza disinformation and hate online?
item.description: How false claims, conspiracy theories and hateful content shapes the general public's view of the war.

item.title: Gaza Strip in maps: What it's like for the people who live there
item.description: Find out more about what it is like to live in the Gaza Strip, from the economy to education, health and water.

item.title: 'I don't eat or sleep' says husband of new mother missing after Hamas attacks
item.description: New mother Celine Ben David Nagar was on a weekend away with friends - now she's thought to be in Gaza.

item.title: Could an Israeli ground invasion of Gaza meet its aims?
item.description: It is now only a matter of time before Israeli forces enter Gaza, with the goal of wiping out Hamas.

item.title: 'I just find bombs, dead people... it's really scary' - British-Palestinian girl in Gaza
item.description: Mariam, a young British-Palestinian trying to cross the border into Egypt, speaks of her fears.

item.title: Hamas massacre captured on Israeli mothers' WhatsApp group
item.description: Messages reveal how trapped families called for help and shared words of comfort as militants killed 100 in their kibbutz.

item.title: History of the conflict explained
item.description: Tensions between Israel and the Palestinians date back decades, but what are the key issues?

item.title: Israel-Gaza conflict proves treacherous ground for US politicians
item.description: Turbulence caused by the fighting in the Middle East could upend the 2024 presidential race.

item.title: BBC crew find injured friends in overrun Gaza hospital
item.description: BBC Arabic reporter Adnan Elbursh visits the main hospital in Gaza City, which is at breaking point.

item.title: Kfar Aza kibbutz massacre: Father saves daughter he hadn’t seen for six years
item.description: Neta had not spoken to her father for years, but she knew he was the only person who could save her.

item.title: How would an Israeli ground assault on Gaza unfold?
item.description: Sending forces into Gaza's densely populated urban areas is an operation fraught with peril.

item.title: Putin is ready to take advantage of Israel-Gaza war, says Steve Rosenberg
item.description: Russia didn't orchestrate this conflict but it could take advantage of it, says the BBC's Russia editor.

item.title: Shots fired as BBC visits scene of Israel festival massacre
item.description: Lucy Williamson visits the site of the Israeli music festival where 260 bodies were discovered.

item.title: Israel targets Hamas’s labyrinth of tunnels under Gaza
item.description: Palestinian militants are thought to have built hundreds of kilometres of tunnels underneath Gaza.

item.title: Son awaits news, good or bad, on missing peace activist
item.description: My mother would say the atrocities are the result of not striving for peace, he tells Jeremy Bowen.

item.title: UK to deploy Navy ships to 'bolster security' in Middle East
item.description: Two ships, surveillance aircraft, helicopters and a detachment of Royal Marines are being dispatched.

item.title: Watch: Breaking down the video of huge Hamas attack
item.description: The BBC’s Gordon Corera investigates exactly how the Palestinian militant group was able to launch its surprise attack on Israel.

item.title: Ex-soldier fought off Hamas and saved kibbutz neighbours
item.description: "I took my pistol, my clothes, my bulletproof vest and the other thing was cigarettes," says Adam.

item.title: British couple trapped in Gaza with no UK help, says son
item.description: Londoners Naila and Talal El-Deeb were visiting family in Gaza when the violence erupted.

item.title: French police break up pro-Palestinian demo after ban
item.description: Tear gas is used after pro-Palestinian rallies are banned as a possible threat to public order.

item.title: Israel sends soldiers to north fearing attack from Hezbollah in Lebanon
item.description: The tension is palpable as Israel reinforces its border against the threat from Hezbollah.

item.title: CCTV shows moment women escape Israeli moshav attack
item.description: The two women managed to run away after Israeli military arrived at the scene.

item.title: TikTok latest social media firm warned by EU over Hamas videos
item.description: The platform follows X and Meta to be urged to step up efforts to stop the spread of disinformation.

item.title: Drone footage shows aftermath of Israeli airstrikes
item.description: More than 1,100 people have been killed by strikes on the Gaza Strip so far.

item.title: Israel hostage crisis is every government's worst nightmare
item.description: Israel has to decide whether to attempt a rescue of those held in Gaza - or wait to strike a deal.

item.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.title: What is happening to house prices, and could there be a crash?
item.description: How higher interest rates are changing the UK's housing market.

item.title: Five ways to save money on your packed lunch
item.description: Grabbing food on the go can be expensive so here are some top tips on making savings at lunchtime.

item.title: Cost of living: Five tips when asking for a pay rise
item.description: Recruiters, a manager and a workplace psychologist give their advice on how to negotiate for more money.

item.title: Renting: Three ways to win the race to securing a property
item.description: From being first in the queue to being more flexible, here are some tips on how to get ahead in the rental race.
